page.title: 13Old Churches,Bromley,S.E.
page.content: There are two very old churches in the area.There was a church in Farnborough in 1292 when a licence was issued for a yearly fair on the Feast of St.Giles. The church was re-built in 1639 after being blown down in a storm.It was re-built by the villagers,using local flint.The tomb of Gypsy Rose Lee,the Queen of the Gypsies,is in the grave-yard.15,000 people went to her funeral. St.Martin of Tours,Chelsfield,C of E,is separated from the village of Chelsfield by the A224,and dates back to Norman times.The sayingÂ£bold as brass' originated from Brass Crosby, whose memorial is in the nave.He was responsible for the freedom to report parliamentary proceedings.
